intro: Veprecella laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered veprecella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. Veprecella laxiflora is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
